verbs.description: disunite (third-person singular simple present disunites, present participle disuniting, simple past and past participle disunited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause disagreement or alienation among or within.
examples: If they cannot disunite them by domestic broils, then they engage their neighbours against them.
I have discovered how to disunite that force and that particle.
You cannot bind me more to you, my lord.
Farewell till we renew... I trust, renew
A converse ne'er to disunite again.
